alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Fayette; Heard; Meriwether; South Fulton; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:29AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Fayette, northwestern Meriwether, southeastern Carroll, Heard, northern Troup, Coweta and southwestern Fulton Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 429 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Texas, or near Franklin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, LaGrange, Franklin, Greenville, City of South Fulton, Peachtree City, Tyrone, Palmetto, Senoia, Hogansville, Grantville, Luthersville, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, Roopville and Haralson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Coweta; Fayette; Heard; Meriwether; South Fulton; Troup
